headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; CITY POLITICS. The Proposed Democratic Fusion at Tammany. THE NEW-YORK PRESS. Organization of the New-York Journalists' Club. A Curions Case at the Mayor's Office. The Sardinian Frigate "Des Geneys" and her Passengers. Extension of Albany-street Again. ALLEGED SARDINIAN OFFENDERS. Rock Blasting in the City. Mr. John B. Holmes in the Court of Sessions. Medical Commencement.

docs.lead_paragraph: Representatives from different newspaper offices in this City assembled at the Astor House on the 1st of February to concert measures for the foundation of a permanent organization of the Press. The meeting was large and enthusiastic, comprising Editors, Publishers, Reporters, Correspondents and occasional Contributors.
docs.snippet: Representatives from different newspaper offices in this City assembled at the Astor House on the 1st of February to concert measures for the foundation of a permanent organization of the Press. The meeting was large and enthusiastic, comprising...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Sardinian frigate Des Geneys, MANTUA, Commander, from Genoa, 67 days, spoke nothing; has experienced heavy weather. The frigate has 166 officers and crew, and 65 passengers, and has only four guns mounted. The commander states that no one of the passengers had been in prison, but were sent out on account of political disturbances. She had anchored at Quarantine, and the

headline.main: ONE WEEK LATER FROM CALIFORNIA.; ARRIVAL OF THE STAR OF THE WEST. $647,000 IN SPECIE. OUTRAGE AT SAN JUAN---GREAT EXCITEMENT. LATER FROM THE HAWAHAN ISLANDS. UTAH NEWS. MARRIAGES, BIRTHS AND DEATHS. MINING NEWS, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Star of the West arrived Sunday night with California dates to March 9. Purser LORD accommodated us with packages and news at an early hour. The steamship Star of the West, Captain TURNER, arrived at Punta Arenas, Nicaragua, on the morning of the 22d and left on the 23d, at noon, with passengers and $647,000 in specie to C. MORGAN. N.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; COLLEGE COMMENCEMENT. The New-York Medical College--Dr. Cox's Address--List of Graduates, &c. ABSTRACT OF DR, COX'S ADDRESS. SHOOTING AFFRAY. Affecting Case. Hard-Hearted Treatment. New Life-Boats. City Mortulity. Robbery of Letters, Bank Notes and Drafts -Arrest of the Robbers. The Law Courts--The Common Council. American Bible Society. The Stanwix Hall Affray--Condition of the Wounded. Sinking of a Brig--Loss of Life--One Body Recovered. Mechanics' Institute. Sudden Death of a Resident of Ohio. The Museum Prize Plays. Mayor's Complaint Book. Shocking Railway Accident.

docs.lead_paragraph: COLLEGE COMMENCEMENT. The New-York Medical College--Dr. Cox's Address--List of Graduates, The upper lecture room of the New-York Medical College was crowded to excess on Thursday evening at an early hour. DODWORTH's Band kept the audience in good humor until the exercises commenced, and between each of the graver exercises of the occasion performed some favorite pieces of music.

headline.main: STATE AFFAIRS.; DEBATE ON THE TEMPERANCE BILL. Resignation of the Adjutant-General. AMENDMENTS TO THE CONSTITUTION.

docs.lead_paragraph: There was a thin attendance, but they did a good day's work in the Assembly yesterday in the way of presenting reports, bills, resolutions, etc. The most important of all was the recommitment of the Police bill to the Judiciary Committee, and the passage of the following resolution in connection with the application of the Manhattan Gas Light Company for an increase of its capital stock:

byline.original: Special Correspondence of the N. Y. Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. CARLETON has written to the Dublin papers an explanation of his defiant lines lately quoted in the DAILY TIMES. It runs thus: "I regret to find that the lines I sent to your paper have either been misunderstood or willfully misinterpreted. I beg to state at once that they were not meant as an appeal to my country for public assistance. I don't stand in need of it.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEATH FROM ETHER IN A DENTIST'S CHAIR.--The Boston Traveller learns from Mr. JOSSELYN, of the Lynn Daily, the following particulars of the death of a female from ether, in that city: It appears that a woman named FARLEY, wife of a carpenter of that name, accompanied by a female friend, went into the office of Dr. ADDISON DAVIS, a well-known dentist of that place, to have a tooth extracted.

headline.main: THE JUDSON LIBEL SUIT.; CLOSE OF THE PROCEEDINGS, VERDICT FOR THE DEFENDANT.
THE BRITISH COMMANDERS.; Brigadier General Adams.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the lightning speed at which the age in which we live, like the engine which represents it, bounds along, we will not be accused of indulging any rosy dream in supposing that in a few short years, the American traveler in quest of pleasure or information will think as little of a trip to Balaklava as he does now to Belgium.
